greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) is the number of entries == 1 mod 4 in row n of Pascal's triangle.
link: Robert Israel, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..10000
Kenneth S. Davis and William A. Webb, Pascal's triangle modulo 4, Fib. Quart., 29 (1991), 79-83.
A. Granville, Zaphod Beeblebrox's Brain and the Fifty-ninth Row of Pascal's Triangle, The American Mathematical Monthly, 99(4) (1992), 318-331.
example: Row 3 of Pascal's triangle is (1,3,3,1) and has two entries == 1 (mod 4), so a(3) = 2.
mathematica: Count[#, 1] & /@ Table[Mod[Binomial[n, k], 4], {n, 0, 120}, {k, 0, n}] (* _Michael De Vlieger_, Feb 26 2017 *)
program: (PARI) a(n) = 2^(hammingweight(n) - min(hammingweight(bitand(n, n>>1)),1)) \\ _Charles R Greathouse IV_, Jul 13 2016
results.author: _Robert Israel_, Jul 12 2016
